item.title: Email to French law professor Yves Strickler
item.description: From: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) Subject: : Bonne Année! Date sent: January 27, 2023, 16:53 (Beijing time) To: Yves Strickler (French law professor) Cc: Many people including the FBI and the State Department, I will update this section later Dear Professor Strickler, Thank you for reminding me to pay close attention to compliance. You are absolutely right! Please don’t worry if you don’t immediately have the time to read all of the emails I am CCing to you regarding the pattern of racketeering activity McDonald’s Corporation has engaged into.

item.title: FORMAL NOTICE to McDonald’s executives, including future CEO Chris Kempczinski, about the illegality of the McDonald’s Monopoly sweepstakes in the United States
item.description: From: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) Subject: FORMAL NOTICE : ILLEGAL LOTTERY USA Date sent: February 14, 2017, 23:21 (Beijing time) To: Chris Kempczinski <Chris.Kempczinski@us.mcd.com>, Steve Easterbrook <Steve.Easterbrook@us.mcd.com>, Gloria Santona <Gloria.Santona@us.mcd.com>, Malcolm Hicks <Malcolm.Hicks@eu.mcd.com>, Silvia Lagnado (Silvia.Lagnado@us.mcd.com), Deborah Wahl <Deborah.Wahl@us.mcd.com> THIS EMAIL CONTAINS WHAT I BELIEVE TO BE VERY IMPORTANT LEGAL INFORMATION. DON’T DISREGARD IT! Dear Sir or Madam, This a formal notice to warn you that your McDonald’s Monopoly sweepstakes in the United States actually qualifies, to the best of my knowledge, as an illegal lottery!

item.title: Notification to McDonald’s executives Gloria Santona, Steve Easterbrook, and Malcolm Hicks
item.description: From: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) SUBJECT: defamation against my consumer protection websites DATE: December 8, 2016 at 00:05 (Beijing time +0800) TO : Gloria Santona <Gloria.Santona@us.mcd.com>, Steve Easterbrook <Steve.Easterbrook@us.mcd.com>, Malcolm Hicks <Malcolm.Hicks@eu.mcd.com> I forgot to mention… As for me, I am going to file a lawsuit against “X” (but targeting McDonald’s) for, among other things, defamation. Indeed, it seems some of your executives were behind some defamatory comment against my websites.

item.title: PLEASE STOP THE FRAUD!
item.description: From: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) Subject: please stop the fraud! Date sent: 2015-10-30 at 22:25 (Beijing time +0800) To: Steve Easterbrook <Steve.Easterbrook@us.mcd.com>, Gloria Santona <Gloria.Santona@us.mcd.com>, Malcolm Hicks <Malcolm.Hicks@eu.mcd.com> Dear Mr. Easterbrook, dear Ms. Santona, and dear Mr. Hicks, I repeat again. Please stop the fraud. You must make it stop! I know you know this “game” is a fraud under European laws. You can not possibly be so stupid not to understand except if you don’t understand on purpose so that you can later claim plausible deniability.

item.title: Additional frauds; email sent to McDonald’s General Counsel CCed to McDonald’s CEO
item.description: From: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) Subject: additional frauds Date sent: 2015-10-22 11:06 (Beijing time +0800) To: Gloria Santona <Gloria.Santona@us.mcd.com> Cc: Steve Easterbrook <Steve.Easterbrook@us.mcd.com> Ms Santona, Thank you for answering me. Could you please make sure the French team communicate with me by email? Normal mail takes forever for me to receive now that I live in China and I am not going to wait one month to act if there is an ongoing fraud.

item.title: Reply from Gloria Santona, General Counsel of McDonald’s Corporation
item.description: KEY POINT OF THIS EVENT: By acknowledging that McDonald’s Corporation executives “take such inquiries seriously”, McDonald’s Corporation can’t claim plausible deniability anymore. Furthermore, the email from Ms. Santona who is the General Counsel of McDonald’s Corporation is CCed to the CEO of McDonald’s Corporation Steve Easterbrook. From: Gloria Santona <Gloria.Santona@us.mcd.com> Subject: Re: update Date received：2015-10-21 23:47 (Beijing time +0800) To: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) Cc: Steve Easterbrook <Steve.Easterbrook@us.mcd.com> Thanks for your follow-up note.

item.title: Email sent to Gloria Santona, General Counsel of McDonald’s Corporation, requesting an update
item.description: From: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) Subject: update Date sent：2015-10-21 22:45 (Beijing time +0800) To: Gloria Santona <Gloria.Santona@us.mcd.com> Cc: Steve Easterbrook <Steve.Easterbrook@us.mcd.com> Ms. Santona, I would like to give a friendly reminder that I gave McDonald’s a deadline of October 22nd 2015 midnight GMT time. So you have about 36 hours left. It was 4 entire days which is more than enough considering I’ve sent my first cease and desist letter back in 2012.

item.title: Email sent to Gloria Santona, General Counsel of McDonald’s Corporation, requesting an update
item.description: Ms. Santona, I would like to give a friendly reminder that I gave McDonald’s a deadline of October 22nd 2015 midnight GMT time. So you have about 36 hours left. It was 4 entire days which is more than enough considering I’ve sent my first cease and desist letter back in 2012. On top of this, had I known that the French branch had started scamming people again, I would have at the time only given you 24 to 48 hours.

item.title: McDonald’s 2014 Annual Report - evidence
item.description: Type of evidence: McDonalds2014AnnualReport.PDF Page 15, out of 64, states that “Gloria Santona, 64, is Corporate Executive Vice President, General Counsel and Secretary, a position she has held since July 2003. Ms. Santona has been with the Company for 37 years.” (I emphasize) Page 15, out of 64, states that “Stephen J. Easterbrook, 47, was promoted, effective March 1, 2015, to President and Chief Executive Officer. Mr. Easterbrook was also elected a Director effective March 1, 2015.
